intro: Comastoma pulmonarium subsp. arrectum, commonly known as the upright lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems bearing clusters of bell-shaped, pinkish-purple flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and floral structure are adapted to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
